page.title: 16Denstone Village
page.content: Denstone is a small rural village in North Staffordshire sited above the flood plain of the River Churnet.It is approximately equidistant from the market towns of Uttoxeter,Cheadle and Ashbourne,coming largely under the influence of Uttoxeter.The village , which became a seperate parish in the latter part of the 18th century, originally served the surrounding farming community but is now largely residential,several small housing estates having recently been built.The village provides little employment and the amenities are limited to a public house,a garage,a small general store,a hairdresserÂ£s and a post office. When Denstone was established as a parish,a church,school,and vicarage were built by Sir Percival Heywood,the benefactor of Denstone.
